result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob T Krigbaum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: for return of property
for the 10/11/16 Sentencing Hearing filed by Court Reporter Christine Champeau
Columbia County Court Conviction DNA - DNA taken
Filed by Atty Mark Lawton

Defendant Jacob T Krigbaum in court with attorney Mark David Lawton.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin, noted restitution has been paid in full. Sentencing statements made. Court sentenced defendant to $705 fine, 60 days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts. Submit DNA sample. Court sentenced defendant to 5 days jail. Court granted 4 days jail credit. Court deemed time served.
from Atty Lawton re: defendant's sentencing
Restitution Stipulation in the total amount of $314.21
